body_html:
@vrv I have no problem with mocha.git. It was @jayendra13's error.
I was able to fix my issue. I was trying to build the android sample. I noticed that to be able to build the android sample, you need to first build other dependencies such as protobuf, etc.
I would ideally expect calling
bazel build //tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo ,
should automatically build dependencies if already not built. Am I right?
So if you have a clean workspace, build bazel android_demo does not work.

body:
@vrv I have no problem with mocha.git. It was @jayendra13's error.
I was able to fix my issue. I was trying to build the android sample. I noticed that to be able to build the android sample, you need to first build other dependencies such as protobuf, etc. 
I would ideally expect calling
 `bazel build //tensorflow/examples/android:tensorflow_demo` ,
should automatically build dependencies if already not built. Am I right?
So if you have a clean workspace, build bazel android_demo does not work.
